spriteBatch.End() causes a IndexOutOfRange error on Android.

data.title: Update repository references
data.body:
This changes all mono/MonoGame references to MonoGame/MonoGame.

Oddly enough, there's a new MonoGame/MonoGame Gitter room, and the old one doesn't redirect. I think @tomspilman or someone else should give them a poke.

data.title: Fix Android launch (no EFX)
data.body: The code assumed that EFX was available if it wasn't built for MONOMAC.  Replaced that with a SUPPORTS_EFX symbol that is defined if it is not MONOMAC and not GLES because the GLES platforms still use OpenTK.OpenAL.

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] Minor Improvements
data.body:
Stuff done:
- improves property type detection (fixes: #5081)
- fixes slash usage in Pip Controller, regarding of OS it should always be "/" (fixes #5082)

data.title: VideoPlayer.WMS improvements and features (take 2)
data.body:
Recreated from PR #4811

Create video texture once and re-use it instead of creating a new texture each frame.
Implement looped video support.

Video events should be dispatched via the FrameworkDispatcher once it is implemented.

data.title: DX11 Multisample Quality fix
data.body:
DX11 Multisample Quality was being set to the maximum, even if the desired multisample quality was lower.  For example, the dev selects a multisample count of 4.  The code checks for the maximum available, which in my case was 8.  This returns a quality level of 33.  The code previously was setting multisampleDesc.Count to 4 but multisampleDesc.Quality was being set to 32 (quality level - 1 for a multisample count of 8).  This resulted in an incorrect argument HRESULT when creating the swapchain.

The change here now calculates the quality level for the selected multisample count, not the highest.

data.title: Pipeline: rename item inside a directory move it to root folder
data.body:
create a new project
create a folder "folder1"
add an existing item to this folder (tested with a FBX model and a JPEG picture)
select the item
rename
=> item is move to the root folder

project before:

> # begin folder1/art2.png
> 
> /importer:TextureImporter
> /processor:TextureProcessor
> /processorParam:ColorKeyColor=255,0,255,255
> /processorParam:ColorKeyEnabled=True
> /processorParam:GenerateMipmaps=False
> /processorParam:PremultiplyAlpha=True
> /processorParam:ResizeToPowerOfTwo=False
> /processorParam:MakeSquare=False
> /processorParam:TextureFormat=Color
> /build:folder1/art2.png

and after renaming (art2.png -> art3.png):

> # begin folder1\art3.png
> 
> /importer:TextureImporter
> /processor:TextureProcessor
> /processorParam:ColorKeyColor=255,0,255,255
> /processorParam:ColorKeyEnabled=True
> /processorParam:GenerateMipmaps=False
> /processorParam:PremultiplyAlpha=True
> /processorParam:ResizeToPowerOfTwo=False
> /processorParam:MakeSquare=False
> /processorParam:TextureFormat=Color
> /build:folder1\art3.png

item art3.png is displayed OUTSIDE its folder, note the folder separator above, switched from '/' to '\'

again, same config as the other issues.
And... sorry @cra0zy to give you more work to do ;)

data.title: Do not omit filename and line number information from the first error during effect compilation
data.body:
Currently effect compilation exceptions result in a message like this: (this is with #5077 applied)

```
warning X3206: implicit truncation of vector type
C:\Users\June\Documents\Projects\Protogame\Protogame.Resources\effect.BuiltinSurface.fx(432,20): warning X3206: implicit truncation of vector type
C:\Users\June\Documents\Projects\Protogame\Protogame.Resources\effect.BuiltinSurface.fx(306,2): error X4000: variable 'output' used without having been completely initialized
```

This fixes the code so it always includes the filename and line number reported by the shader compiler as the location of the error:

```
C:\Users\June\Documents\Projects\Protogame\Protogame.Resources\effect.BuiltinSurface.fx(432,20): warning X3206: implicit truncation of vector type
C:\Users\June\Documents\Projects\Protogame\Protogame.Resources\effect.BuiltinSurface.fx(432,20): warning X3206: implicit truncation of vector type
C:\Users\June\Documents\Projects\Protogame\Protogame.Resources\effect.BuiltinSurface.fx(306,2): error X4000: variable 'output' used without having been completely initialized
```

data.title: Allow #line directives to be used in .fx files
data.body:
This allows `#line` directives to be used in effect files.

As part of Protogame, we have our own asset system which underneath passes effect code to MonoGame's content pipeline for compilation.  To do this, we write the effect code to a temporary file on disk, and tell the effect processor to compile that file.  We preemptively resolve includes on the string in memory before we pass the effect code to MonoGame, so there are no external dependencies on other files.

Right now, the CppNet preprocessor strips out any `#line` directives in the source code, even though they are recognised by the underlying shader compiler.  We want to use `#line` directives when we pass the content into MonoGame's content pipeline so that the filenames and line numbers match with our actual source files, and don't just have the temporary filename on disk (and incorrectly offset line numbers due to includes).

This change detects `#line` directives before they are passed into CppNet, and encodes them as a comment.  When reading the output from the preprocessor, they then get transformed back into `#line` directives again so that they exist for the underlying shader compiler.

data.title: Multiple Videoplayers (Windows)
data.body:
Hi,
I tried to use multiple Videoplayers simultaneously. The first Videoplayer worked fine but already the second didn't work at all. I looked at the source code [https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Media/VideoPlayer.WMS.cs](https://github.com/MonoGame/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Media/VideoPlayer.WMS.cs) and there are the fields _session, _clock and so on all static. I think they must not be static to support multiple Videoplayers.

data.title: Fix crash when DynamicSoundEffectInstance not disposed

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
I had a look at the following SharpDX sample 
https://github.com/sharpdx/SharpDX-Samples/blob/master/Desktop/XAudio2/PlaySound/Program.cs#L42

and MasteringVoice is just disposed without calling `MasteringVoice.DestroyVoice`. This avoids the crash when other SFX are not disposed. I did a test for XNA and disposing a Game does not dispose of sound effects that are not yet disposed, so it's left to the user there too. If this is the right way of shutting down XAudio2 we can also remove `SoundEffect.PlatformShutdown` in `Game.Dispose`.

fixes #5064, fixes #5070

data.title: SoundEffect not loading on Cross Desktop GL on Mac
data.body:
This [sound](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B9nWV0CYYRuZTW1SdTZKNGZqU2s/view?usp=sharing) works fine on Windows GL, Windows DX, and Windows UWP using the current develop branch. Does not work on MacOS using the cross platform template (Android, iOS, and Xamarin.mac give different errors). On the Mac, it fails at the Content.Load<SoundEffect>("testsound"). XS gets a spin cursor for a while before it really stops, almost like it is gotten into a nested loop allocating memory or trying to allocate a really large chunk. The error I get isn't very helpful and I do not know where to set the breakpoint to see the actual error.

data.title: Do not create window for tests to speed them up
data.body:
Part of this was originally done in #5069. This changes tests that were visual, but did not actually need that. This will speed up tests a bit and make it easier to implement new tests. Note that this is not yet finished.

For now this just does tests that do not need to draw, but do need a GraphicsDevice. While working on this I figured we can go further than that and even tests that do draw not use a window. Draw tests can render to a render target without actually running the game loop. That would make almost all tests not use a window and will improve testing performance and make it easier to implement new visual tests because you can just draw as you would in your game Draw function. Thoughts on this? Either way I'll do the non-drawing tests first.

data.title: [Dev Pipeline Tool UX] exits app when clicking on any of the content items

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
After opening a .mgcb file with the Pipeline UX from the current Develop branch, clicking on any content item terminates the application on MacOS El Capitan. I am using build v3.6.0.742 install files. Running the app from terminal yields the following errors/exception:


data.title: Wrong usage of weakreferences in DynamicSoundEffectInstanceManager
data.body:
I already commented this in the commit, but seems to be ignored or something.

In DynamicSoundEffectInstanceManager.UpdatePlayingInstances() is an iteration over all playingInstances with a check of IsAlive and getting the target of a WeakReference. This can generate in very rare cases NullReferenceExceptions because the GC removes the instance between these lines of code.

The check should - like in all other cases of weak references I found in the source code - check Target directly to null.

data.title: GraphicsDeviceManager fixes
data.body:
This is not finished yet, but I'm sharing so people that are interested and/or worried can follow progress and advise. This is a start to getting GraphicsDevice and GraphicsDeviceManager events right and handling PresentationParameters the same as in XNA.

I may have done a seperate PR for this, but I also added a simple method to TestGameBase that initializes the game without creating a window. This can speed up a lot of test that are 'visual' but don't need to be. I already fixed a couple that just needed a GraphicsDevice, but not necessarily a window... Actually, most tests don't **really** need a window, right? Note that we can't get around that for XNA tests. Other tests that can benefit are RasterizerState and Viewport among others.

There's more testing to be done and GraphicsDevice events also needs its events fixed, but that might be better to do in a seperate PR. I did do the Disposed event though, because of how easy it was and I couldn't resist :p

This fixes at least (I'll add issues here as I find them)
- fixes #539
- fixes #4433
- fixes #3114

data.title: [DO NOT MERGE] Idea for Pipeline Tool Tests
data.body:
@tomspilman This was my idea on how to handle Pipeline Tool Tests, what do you think?

PS. "FileTests" is as in "File Menu Tests"

data.title: [SDL] Fixed Hardware mode switch change detection
data.body: If we are already in fullscreen (soft or hard) and we only change the "HardwareModeSwitch" property we need to detect that and act accordingly.

hi,

the code bug with this message: An unhandled exception of type 'System.AccessViolationException' occurred in SharpDX.XAudio2.dll.

I read this discusion on the monogame forum: [http://community.monogame.net/t/solved-accessviolationexception-in-soundeffectinstance-apply3d-l-e/1980/3]

my ".wav" file in stereo. it would be very difficult to change that at the current level of my project.

Please if anyone has an idea to resolve this issue?

data.title: [Pipeline Tool] General Fixes
data.body:
Fixes extracted from #4998

Includes:
- fix type passing
- adds char cell

data.title: Track DynamicSoundEffectInstances so they can be disposed

milestone.title: 3.6 Release
milestone.description: More unit tests, running unit tests on Mac and Linux, SDL2 replacing OpenTK.

data.body:
For **XAudio**, when there are voices that are not yet disposed when [MasterVoice is disposed](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffect.XAudio.cs#L351) a crash will occur as noted in [`SoundEffect.Shutdown`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffectInstancePool.cs#L160). This caused our unit tests to fail in #5042. 

We currently have [`SoundEffectInstancePool`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/SoundEffectInstancePool.cs) to manage all SoundEffectInstances (and dispose of them in the Shutdown method) and [`DynamicSoundEffectInstanceManager`](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework/Audio/DynamicSoundEffectInstanceManager.cs) to manage **playing** DynamicSoundEffectInstances, but not ones that are not currently playing. I suggest we let the DSEIManager handle this by having it keep a WeakReference to all instances that are not playing as well.

data.title: Dispose of all SFX in tests to avoid crashing
data.body:
Fixes #5042. 

Trying to dispose XAudio's MasterVoice when not all SFX are disposed caused this crash. This properly disposes of all DynamicSoundEffectInstances in the tests. Maybe dynamic sound effects also be added to some static collection so they can always be properly disposed?

data.title: Add interfaces to Effect classes
data.body:
Resolves #5057.  This adds new interfaces to the Effect classes, so that engines that want to emulate the effect interface can do so.

In my particular use case, I'm using it to track parameters set against effects so that I can automatically batch rendering later.

data.title: Split GetTitleSafeArea for platform specific implementation
data.body: Follow up on #5058.

data.title: Fix spelling of Borderless enum value
data.body: Fixes #5051
